{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.19553v1", "title": "Extremal Ising Gibbs States on Lobachevsky planes", "summary": "We exhibit an uncountable family of extremal inhomogeneous Gibbs measures of
the low temperature Ising model on regular tilings of the hyperbolic plane.
These states arise as low temperature perturbations of local ground states
having a sparse enough set of frustrated edges, the sparseness being measured
in terms of the isoperimetric constant of the graph. This result is implied by
an extension of the article [9] on regular trees to non-amenable graphs. We
argue how we can deduce the extremality of an uncountable subset of the
Series-Sinai states [30] at low temperature.", "main_category": "math.PR", "categories": "math.PR,cond-mat.stat-mech,math-ph,math.MP", "published": "2025-04-28T07:58:51Z"}
